parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party. It focuses on a local environmental issue concerning the cutting down of trees in IOR park.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a public Facebook post with a paid promotion, aiming to reach a wide audience in Bucharest and Ilfov County, encouraging participation in a community action to protect the park.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is not to influence the vote for any candidate in the parliamentary elections.  It aims to mobilize citizens for environmental action and protection of a public space. There is no mention of any political party or candidate, nor any attempt to sway public opinion towards a particular political stance.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. While the post presents information about the situation in IOR park, it goes beyond simple reporting and actively encourages participation in a specific action.  It could be considered a form of citizen journalism, but its call to action blurs the line with advocacy.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post presents a factual situation (tree cutting) and proposes a concrete course of action. While it expresses concern and urgency, it does not express a personal opinion unrelated to the described situation.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2281651368860783</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post does not constitute electoral propaganda.  While it falls under the "POLITICAL" category due to its public nature and the involvement of citizens, it lacks any direct or indirect reference to any parliamentary candidate or party. Its primary goal is to raise awareness about and encourage participation in a local environmental issue, not to influence the outcome of the parliamentary elections. The paid promotion serves to amplify the reach of this community action, not to promote a political agenda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>AICI A FOST O PĂDURE / AICI AR PUTEA FI O PĂDURE</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
